headline: Ex-Chelsea defender Deanna Cooper joins Newcastle United Women
summary: Newcastle United have signed former Brighton and Chelsea defender Deanna Cooper who recently left Reading. She won two WSL titles while at Chelsea and made 68 league appearances for the Royals over four seasons. Cooper […]

headline: Southampton Women sign Freya Gregory on season-long loan
summary: Southampton have signed 21-year-old England U-23 forward Freya Gregory on a season-long loan from Aston Villa. The last two years have seen her loaned out to Leicester City and Reading, while stepping up to England […]

headline: Newcastle United Women sign Amy Andrews from Durham
summary: Newcastle United have signed 24-year-old forward Amy Andrews from Barclays Women’s Championship rivals Durham. She joined Durham last summer, following prolific spells in the USA with Western Illinois University and Tormenta FC, winning the USL […]

headline: Arsenal draw Rangers in UEFA Women’s Champions League
summary: The 2024/25 UEFA Women’s Champions League Round 1 draw sees Arsenal play Rangers in the group semi-finals. The victors will meet the winners of the tie between Atlético Madrid and Rosenborg in League Path group […]

headline: Aston Villa Women sign Jill Baijings on loan from Bayern Munich
summary: Aston Villa Women have sealed the loan signing of Netherlands international midfielder Jill Baijings from Bayern Munich. The 23-year-old joined Bayern in 2023 and has also previously played for Heerenveen, SGS Essen and Bayer Leverkusen, […]

headline: Manchester City Women confirm signing of Vivianne Miedema
summary: Manchester City have signed 27-year-old Dutch international Vivianne Miedema on a three-year deal following her departure from Arsenal. Miedema is the record goalscorer in Barclays Women’s Super League history and also for the Netherlands, netting […]

headline: Fran Kirby joins Brighton & Hove Albion Women
summary: Brighton & Hove Albion have completed the signing of England international Fran Kirby following her nine years at Chelsea. The 31-year-old attacking midfielder won seven WSL titles, five FA Cups and two Conti Cups at […]
